page.title: 12Purbrook Heath Farm
page.content: Mr. Heath owns a dairy farm. He uses his 88 acres for cows, apart from a tiny 3 acres for potatoes. The farm is over 100 years old. (He has farmed there since 1969). During World War One the farm grew vegetables, under control. He has 1 cow dog to look after 90 cows, 50 of which are milking ones. He gets 223000 litres of milk a year. He keeps his grass for cows under tyres. Most of his cows are Friesian. He has two boys, one helps on the farm. He does his own milking twice a day at 6.00 a.m. and 3.30 p.m. and can milk four cows at a time with his milking machine. He sells his potatoes at the gate, and keeps poultry which he sells for the table. The farm is part of the Southwick Estate which altogether covers fourteen square miles.
